course_title: Ethics in Global Health and Development
course_description: The goal of this course is to provide students with opportunities and strategies to critically examine and address ethical challenges associated with key aspects of global health and global development. Each topic will be introduced through real-world case studies and scenarios and students will be challenged to develop conceptual thinking and problem-solving skills by participating in problem scenarios and immersive activities, including mock advisory panels and policy consultations.
sections: Class Nbr: 5377, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 3:10-5p, Instructor: J. Lavery, Status: Open
